data.quote: The sacred rights of mankind are not to be rummaged for among old parchments or musty records. They are written, as with a sunbeam, in the whole volume of human nature, by the hand of the divinity itself; and can never be erased.

data.quote: My height doesn't define my skill set. To be a great quarterback, you have to have great leadership, great attention to detail and a relentless competitive nature - and I try to bring that on a daily basis.

data.quote: Man's nature is not essentially evil. Brute nature has been known to yield to the influence of love. You must never despair of human nature.
data.author: Mahatma Gandhi

data.quote: For I have learned to look on nature, not as in the hour of thoughtless youth, but hearing oftentimes the still, sad music of humanity.

data.quote: Nature has no principles. She makes no distinction between good and evil.

data.quote: Reason is a supple nymph, and slippery as a fish by nature. She had as leave give her kiss to an absurdity any day, as to syllogistic truth. The absurdity may turn out truer.

data.quote: The learned is happy, nature to explore; The fool is happy, that he knows no more.
data.author: Alexander Pope

data.quote: With the coming of spring, I am calm again.

data.quote: Nature is wont to hide herself.

data.quote: Moonlight is sculpture.

data.author: Mahatma Gandhi

data.quote: We must use the wrath of nature as our teacher.

data.quote: Nature surrounds us, from parks and backyards to streets and alleyways. Next time you go out for a walk, tread gently and remember that we are both inhabitants and stewards of nature in our neighbourhoods.

data.quote: The true nature of evil is that it is so very casual.
data.author: James St. James

data.quote: A God without dominion, providence, and final causes, is nothing else but fate and nature.
data.author: Alexander Pope

data.quote: I love not man the less, but Nature more.

data.quote: Flowers are without hope. Because hope is tomorrow and flowers have no tomorrow.
data.author: Antonio Porchia

data.quote: Human judges can show mercy. But against the laws of nature, there is no appeal.
data.author: Arthur C. Clarke

data.quote: Nature is an infinite sphere of which the center is everywhere and the circumference nowhere.
data.author: Blaise Pascal

data.quote: In wilderness I sense the miracle of life, and behind it our scientific accomplishments fade to trivia.
data.author: Charles Lindbergh

data.quote: I perhaps owe having become a painter to flowers.

data.quote: The sun, too, shines into cesspools and is not polluted.

data.quote: There's always a period of curious fear between the first sweet-smelling breeze and the time when the rain comes cracking down.

data.quote: The subtlety of nature is greater many times over than the subtlety of the senses and understanding.

data.quote: You can't be suspicious of a tree, or accuse a bird or a squirrel of subversion or challenge the ideology of a violet.

data.quote: The counterfeit and counterpart of Nature is reproduced in art.

data.quote: What nature delivers to us is never stale. Because what nature creates has eternity in it.

data.quote: Sorrows gather around great souls as storms do around mountains; but, like them, they break the storm and purify the air of the plain beneath them.

data.quote: One must ask children and birds how cherries and strawberries taste.

data.quote: Earth is a flower and it's pollinating.

data.quote: Nature is a petrified magic city.

data.quote: He that will enjoy the brightness of sunshine, must quit the coolness of the shade.

data.quote: Nature's music is never over; her silences are pauses, not conclusions.

data.quote: My boy, one small breeze doesn't make a wind storm.

data.quote: Nature was here a series of wonders, and a fund of delight.

data.quote: There's no night without stars.

data.quote: We have the capacity to receive messages from the stars and the songs of the night winds.

data.quote: My progress was rendered delightful by the sylvan elegance of the groves, chearful meadows, and high distant forests, which in grand order presented themselves to view.

data.quote: There is but one law for all, namely that law which governs all law, the law of our Creator, the law of humanity, justice, equity - the law of nature and of nations.

data.quote: In the same way the sun never grows weary of shining, nor a stream of flowing, it is God's nature to keep His promises. Therefore, go immediately to His throne and say, 'Do as You promised.'

data.quote: Nature gives you the face you have at twenty it is up to you to merit the face you have at fifty.

data.quote: At Baptism, I received grace - that quality that makes me share in the very nature of God.

data.quote: Nature that framed us of four elements, warring within our breasts for regiment, doth teach us all to have aspiring minds.

data.quote: Truth is by nature self-evident. As soon as you remove the cobwebs of ignorance that surround it, it shines clear.

data.quote: Nothing happens to any man that he is not formed by nature to bear.
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.quote: It is human nature to instinctively rebel at obscurity or ordinariness.
data.author: Taylor Caldwell

data.quote: Nature is relentless and unchangeable, and it is indifferent as to whether its hidden reasons and actions are understandable to man or not.

data.quote: Nature is the one song of praise that never stops singing.

data.quote: God who created us has granted us the faculty of speech that we might disclose the counsels of our hearts to one another and that, since we possess our human nature in common, each of us might share his thoughts with his neighbor, bringing them forth from the secret recesses of the heart as from a treasury.
data.author: Saint Basil

data.quote: Some advice: keep the flame of curiosity and wonderment alive, even when studying for boring exams. That is the well from which we scientists draw our nourishment and energy. And also, learn the math. Math is the language of nature, so we have to learn this language.
data.author: Michio Kaku

data.quote: As instruments for knowing the objects, the sense organs are outside, and so they are called outer senses; and the mind is called the inner sense because it is inside. data.author: Ramana Maharshi

data.quote: The Analytical Engine does not occupy common ground with mere 'calculating machines.' It holds a position wholly its own, and the considerations it suggests are more interesting in their nature.

data.quote: By nature, I really am a fairly bouncy and sunny individual.

data.quote: It is good to realize that if love and peace can prevail on earth, and if we can teach our children to honor nature's gifts, the joys and beauties of the outdoors will be here forever.

data.quote: We must all obey the great law of change. It is the most powerful law of nature.

data.quote: Nothing in the nature around us is evil. This needs to be repeated since one of the human ways of talking oneself into inhuman acts is to cite the supposed cruelty of nature.

data.quote: The scientific observer of Nature is a kind of mystic seeker in the act of prayer.

Nature is a bigger force than you.

data.quote: In the Pythagorean system, thinking about numbers, or doing mathematics, was an inherently masculine task. Mathematics was associated with the gods, and with transcendence from the material world; women, by their nature, were supposedly rooted in this latter, baser realm.

data.quote: You and I are, by birth, by nature, and by choice, inwardly depraved, which is to say that we are entirely corrupt. That's not to say that we have no good in us; we do. data.quote: If nothing else, the act of reaching a milestone often serves to reveal a superstar's true nature.

data.quote: We live in a very chaotic world that sometimes we - it just seems like a mess. data.quote: It is the nature of the self to manifest itself, In every atom slumbers the might of the self.

data.quote: Art is the objectification of feeling, and the subjectification of nature.

data.quote: Wisdom is a kind of knowledge. It is knowledge of the nature, career, and consequences of human values.

data.quote: I admire our ancestors, whoever they were. I think the first self-conscious person must have shaken in his boots. Because as he becomes self-conscious, he's no longer part of nature. He sees himself against nature. He looks at the vastness of the universe and it looks hostile.

data.quote: If you violate Nature's laws you are your own prosecuting attorney, judge, jury, and hangman.

data.quote: Blue, green, grey, white, or black; smooth, ruffled, or mountainous; that ocean is not silent.

data.quote: Simplicity is natures first step, and the last of art.

data.quote: There is an electric fire in human nature tending to purify - so that among these human creatures there is continually some birth of new heroism. The pity is that we must wonder at it, as we should at finding a pearl in rubbish.

data.quote: There is no glory in star or blossom till looked upon by a loving eye There is no fragrance in April breezes till breathed with joy as they wander by.

data.quote: It is a holy blessing to be born with the exquisite qualities of a daughter of God. Women of God, both old and young, are spiritual and sensitive, tender and gentle. data.quote: This sunlight linked me through the ages to that past consciousness.

data.quote: To me a lush carpet of pine needles or spongy grass is more welcome than the most luxurious Persian rug.

data.quote: Birds have wings they're free they can fly where they want when they want. They have the kind of mobility many people envy.

data.quote: While we are under the tyranny of Priests, it will ever be their interest, to invalidate the law of nature and reason, in order to establish systems incompatible therewith.

data.quote: All nature is but art unknown to thee.

data.quote: The good is, like nature, an immense landscape in which man advances through centuries of exploration.

data.quote: When women reassert their relationship with the wildish nature, they are gifted with a permanent and internal watcher, a knower, a visionary, an oracle, an inspiratrice, an intuitive, a maker, a creator, an inventor, and a listener who guide, suggest, and urge vibrant life in the inner and outer world.

data.quote: Purity and simplicity are the two wings with which man soars above the earth and all temporary nature.

data.quote: Perhaps nature is our best assurance of immortality.
data.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

data.quote: Nature chooses who will be transgender individuals don't choose this.
data.author: Mercedes Ruehl

data.quote: Nature has given women so much power that the law has very wisely given them little.

data.quote: Now that I'm older, I have a much better appreciation of nature, and I love being alone.

data.quote: What I'm attempting to do is to show people that if I can spend some time with very dangerous spiders and snakes and scorpions, then maybe they'll feel different about the spiders and snakes they find around their areas. I don't need people to keep them as pets. I just like them to be respectful and see that everything in nature has its place.

data.quote: When there is in nature no fixed condition, how much less must there be in the life of a people, beings endowed with mobility and movement!

data.quote: We are all full of weakness and errors let us mutually pardon each other our follies - it is the first law of nature.

data.quote: Nature abhors a hero. For one thing, he violates the law of conservation of energy. For another, how can it be the survival of the fittest when the fittest keeps putting himself in situations where he is most likely to be creamed?

data.quote: The increase of scientific knowledge lies not only in the occasional milestones of science, but in the efforts of the very large body of men who with love and devotion observe and study nature.

data.quote: I had to live in the desert before I could understand the full value of grass in a green ditch.
data.author: Ella Maillart

data.quote: The thing that gave me the most pain in life, psychologically, and it gave me tremendous pain psychologically, is man's disrespect for nature.

data.quote: If we could establish a deep abiding relationship with nature, we would never kill an animal for our appetite; we would never harm, vivisect, a monkey, a dog, a guinea pig for our benefit. We would find other ways to heal our wounds, heal our bodies.

data.quote: This magnificent butterfly finds a little heap of dirt and sits still on it but man will never on his heap of mud keep still.

data.quote: In the Spring, I have counted 136 different kinds of weather inside of 24 hours.
data.author: Mark Twain

data.quote: Nature has never read the Declaration of Independence. It continues to make us unequal.
data.author: Will Durant

data.quote: Nature uses human imagination to lift her work of creation to even higher levels.
data.author: Luigi Pirandello

data.quote: The beautiful spring came; and when Nature resumes her loveliness, the human soul is apt to revive also.
data.author: Harriet Ann Jacobs

data.quote: Human nature is not nearly as bad as it has been thought to be.
data.author: Abraham Maslow

data.quote: Envy is human nature.
data.author: Monica Bellucci

data.quote: Borrow trouble for yourself, if that's your nature, but don't lend it to your neighbours.
